original: rang nyid lha yi rnal 'byor ni //
analyzed: rang nyid lha yi rnal 'byor ni //
translated: And the yoga of the deity itself

original: gnyis med sngags dang phyag rgyar brtag /
analyzed: gnyis med sngags dang phyag rgyar brtag /
translated: Is imagined as nondual mantra and mudra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje snying po rgyan ces bya ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje snying po rgyan ces bya ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po las /
translated: From the Great King of Tantra called the Ornament of the Vajra Essence of All Tathāgatas,

original: phyag rgya'i rim par phye ba'o ////
analyzed: phyag rgya'i rim par phye ba'o ////
translated: This is the chapter on the sequence of mudras.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad slar yang 'dus par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad slar yang 'dus par gyur te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, all the tathāgatas, gathered again

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba chen po rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po la gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba chen po rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po la gsol ba btab pa /
translated: And supplicated the great lord of vajra yoga, the great universal monarch of all tathāgatas:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs bskyed par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs bskyed par mdzad du gsol /
translated: “Please generate the family of all tathāgatas.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de dag gis gsol ba btab pa'i tshig nye bar gsan nas 'og min gyi gnas nas byon te dga' ldan gyi gnas su bzhugs nas dga' ldan gyi ris kyi lha'i bu rnams la chos bstan nas zas gtsang gi rigs la
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de dag gis gsol ba btab pa'i tshig nye bar gsan nas 'og min gyi gnas nas byon te dga' ldan gyi gnas su bzhugs nas dga' ldan gyi ris kyi lha'i bu rnams la chos bstan nas zas gtsang gi rigs la
translated: Then the bhagavān Śākyamuni, having heard the words of the supplication, descended from the Akaniṣṭha realm and resided in the Tuṣita realm. Having taught the Dharma to the Tuṣita devas, he saw that it was time for him to be born into the family of Śuddhodana.

original: mngon par gzigs te mngon par byung bar mdzad nas byang chub kyi snying po dag la nye bar gnas nas nye bar 'khod de bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal bar bstan nas byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par gzigs te mngon par byung bar mdzad nas byang chub kyi snying po dag la nye bar gnas nas nye bar 'khod de bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal bar bstan nas byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs par gyur te /
translated: He manifested his descent, approached the Bodhimaṇḍa, and sat down. Having demonstrated his victory over the four māras, he sat upon the Bodhimaṇḍa.

original: bzhugs nas kyang kun nas 'phro ba'i ting nge 'dzin sngon du @43a *//
analyzed: bzhugs nas kyang kun nas 'phro ba'i ting nge 'dzin sngon du @43a *//
translated: Having sat there, he entered into the samādhi called the emanation,

original: 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin bye ba brgya stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin bye ba brgya stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: and then into the samādhi called the precursor, and then into the eighty-four thousand samādhis of a hundred thousand myriads.

original: snyoms par zhugs nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje se gol gyi sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan 'dren cing gsang sngags 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje se gol gyi sgras de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan 'dren cing gsang sngags 'di gsungs so //
translated: Having entered into union, by the sound of the vajra snapping fingers of all the tathagatas, all the tathagatas were invited, and he spoke this secret mantra:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra sa m'a dza a'a karsha ya sarba ta th'a ga t'an h'um/
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra sa m'a dza a'a karsha ya sarba ta th'a ga t'an h'um/
translated: Om. All tathagatas, please come here.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'khor dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po rnams legs par byon te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'khor dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po rnams legs par byon te /
translated: Then the great mandalas of all the tathagatas with their retinues arrived well.

original: chos kyi dbyings su spros nas phyogs bcu mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab pa'i rgya mtsho'i sprin rnams bkang ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su spros nas phyogs bcu mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab pa'i rgya mtsho'i sprin rnams bkang ste /
translated: Having emanated into the dharmadhatu, the ocean clouds that pervade all the worlds without limit in the ten directions were filled.🔽All those dwelling in the realm of space were seated in Jambudvipa like a full sesame pod.

original: nam mkha'i khams na gnas pa thams cad til gyi gang bu ltar 'dzam bu'i gling du 'khod par gyur to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gis bkug cing bcug ste bcings nas dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams na gnas pa thams cad til gyi gang bu ltar 'dzam bu'i gling du 'khod par gyur to; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gis bkug cing bcug ste bcings nas dbang du mdzad de /
translated: Then the bhagavat Vajrayogeshvara summoned, brought, bound, and controlled them.

original: de nyid kyi thugs kar rab tu bzhag par gyur to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi thugs kar rab tu bzhag par gyur to //
translated: It was placed at the heart of the Bhagavān.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas byin gyis brlabs te sngags 'dis rang gi sems so sor rtogs par mdzad do; ;aom tsitta pra ti be dhi k'a ro mi /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas byin gyis brlabs te sngags 'dis rang gi sems so sor rtogs par mdzad do; ;aom tsitta pra ti be dhi k'a ro mi /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, the Lord of Great Yoga, blessed it with nondual union and realized his own mind with this mantra: Oṃ citta-prativedha-karo mi.

original: de'i rjes thogs nyid la sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs kar longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul @43b pa'i sku las chos sku rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba sems rin po che nges par phyung ste spros par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs nyid la sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi thugs kar longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul @43b pa'i sku las chos sku rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba sems rin po che nges par phyung ste spros par mdzad do //
translated: Immediately after that, all the buddhas extracted the precious mind of the Bhagavān Vairocana from the dharmakāya, which is naturally luminous, from the saṃbhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya, and caused it to spread at his heart.

original: de nyid sems 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: de nyid sems 'od gsal ba /
translated: That very [mind] is luminous mind,

original: thugs rje chen pos khyab pa /
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos khyab pa /
translated: pervading with great compassion,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid /
translated: the characteristic of the sameness of all tathāgatas,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnyog pa spangs pa /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnyog pa spangs pa /
translated: free from the turbidity of apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: nam mkha' ltar gdod nas zhi ba de las thugs rje chen po la mngon par phyogs par byas nas sems can gyi khams thams cad la rnam par gzigs te mi shes pas rga ba dang / 'chi bas rnam par khyab pa'i 'jig rten la gzigs nas slar yang sngags 'dis byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa nye bar bstan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar gdod nas zhi ba de las thugs rje chen po la mngon par phyogs par byas nas sems can gyi khams thams cad la rnam par gzigs te mi shes pas rga ba dang / 'chi bas rnam par khyab pa'i 'jig rten la gzigs nas slar yang sngags 'dis byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa nye bar bstan pa /
translated: Having seen the world pervaded by ignorance, aging, and death, he again generated the mind of enlightenment with this mantra.

original: aom bo dhi tsitta aud p'a da y'a mi /
analyzed: aom bo dhi tsitta aud p'a da y'a mi /
translated: oṃ bodhicitta utpādayāmi

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i rjes thogs nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kar sems 'od gsal ba de yongs su rdzogs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ltar byin gyis brlabs te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kar rnam par bzhag go /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i rjes thogs nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kar sems 'od gsal ba de yongs su rdzogs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ltar byin gyis brlabs te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kar rnam par bzhag go /
translated: Immediately after generating the mind of enlightenment, he blessed the mind of clear light at the heart of all tathāgatas to be like a perfect moon mandala and placed it at the heart of all tathāgatas.

original: legs par rnam par dag pa'i nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa /
analyzed: legs par rnam par dag pa'i nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa /
translated: It is stainless, like perfectly pure space.

original: spros pa thams cad spangs pa me long lta bur brtan par byas nas gnas te byang chub kyi sems chen po la sngags 'di brjod do //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad spangs pa me long lta bur brtan par byas nas gnas te byang chub kyi sems chen po la sngags 'di brjod do //
translated: Having stabilized the mirror-like [samādhi] that abandons all elaborations, he abides, and utters this mantra of great awakening:

original: aom dzny'a na rasmi bi sri dza:h'um/
analyzed: aom dzny'a na rasmi bi sri dza:h'um/
translated: oṃ jñāna-rasmi-viśva-jaḥ hūṃ.

original: de'i rjes thogs nyid la 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor las rnam par byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs nyid la 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor las rnam par byung ngo //
translated: Immediately after that, various light rays emerge from the moon maṇḍala.

original: de phyung nas kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang du zhugs te shes @44a *//🔽bya'i dkyil 'khor thams cad gsal bar byas nas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi ri bo'i rtse mo bsnyil te rab tu rtogs par byas nas gcig tu 'dres te rdo rje'i sku chen po rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar rjes su zhugs nas zla ba'i dkyil
analyzed: de phyung nas kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi pho brang du zhugs te shes @44a *// bya'i dkyil 'khor thams cad gsal bar byas nas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi ri bo'i rtse mo bsnyil te rab tu rtogs par byas nas gcig tu 'dres te rdo rje'i sku chen po rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar rjes su zhugs nas zla ba'i dkyil
translated: Having emerged, they enter the palace of the dharmadhātu,🔽illuminate all the maṇḍalas of objects of knowledge,🔽topple the mountain peaks of the minds of all sentient beings,

original: 'khor gyi dbus su rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dbus su rab tu gnas so //
translated: and having caused them to be realized, they merge together and enter into the heart of the Bhagavān in the form of a great vajra body, and abide in the center of the moon maṇḍala.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos sngags 'di byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos sngags 'di byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Great Lord of Vajra Yoga, blessed this mantra:

original: aom tishtha badzra pa ra da bhu ya panytsa mu dha /
analyzed: aom tishtha badzra pa ra da bhu ya panytsa mu dha /
translated: Oṃ tiṣṭha vajra para dhuva ya pañca mudra

original: slar yang sngags 'dis spros pa /
analyzed: slar yang sngags 'dis spros pa /
translated: Again, he emanated with this mantra:

original: aom spha ra badzra /
analyzed: aom spha ra badzra /

original: slar yang sngags 'dis bsdus so //
analyzed: slar yang sngags 'dis bsdus so //
translated: Again, he gathered with this mantra:

original: aom sam ha ra badzra /
analyzed: aom sam ha ra badzra /
translated: Oṃ saṃhāra vajra

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ye shes rdo rje'i snying po 'di ched du brjod pa /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ye shes rdo rje'i snying po 'di ched du brjod pa /
translated: Then all the Tathāgatas uttered this essence of vajra wisdom:

original: aom dzny'a na badzra /
analyzed: aom dzny'a na badzra /
translated: Oṃ jñāna vajra

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos sngags 'dis byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen pos sngags 'dis byin gyis brlabs pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Great Lord of Vajra Yoga, blessed with this mantra:

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na badzra h'um/

analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs mnyam pa nyid brnyes pas sngags 'dis byin gyis brlabs pa /

original: aom badzra a'atma konyaham/
analyzed: aom badzra a'atma konyaham/
translated: Oṃ vajra ātmā ko ’haṃ

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad brtan pa nyid du nye bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad brtan pa nyid du nye bar gyur to //
translated: Then all the Tathāgatas became present in a stable manner.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs gzigs nas sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par @44b mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs gzigs nas sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par @44b mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One Vairocana, having seen the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathāgatas, blessed them with this mantra:

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham/
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham/
translated: Oṃ, yaṃ, all tathāgatas, the state of, I am.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa'i rgyu sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku bdag nyid sems can gyi khams thams cad du nges par bstan to //

translated: Then the Blessed One, the body of all the Tathāgatas, the cause of accomplishing the welfare of all sentient beings, the nature of the body of all buddhas, definitely manifested in the realm of all sentient beings.

translated: Then Śakra, Brahmā, and the Lokapālas, having seen this, proclaimed to the gods and humans, “The Blessed One has attained manifest complete enlightenment.”

original: de nas tshangs pas gsol ba btab ste chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor nas de dang nges 'dul ba'i skye bo btul te gang gis slar ldog pa med pa nyid du gyur to //

translated: Then, having been requested by Brahmā, he turned the wheel of the Dharma and subdued the beings to be tamed, so that they became irreversible.

original: 'di rnams ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni /
translated: These are

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sgom pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub sgom pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: the stages of cultivating the enlightenment of the Buddha.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bstan te /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān Vairocana arose from that samādhi and taught the enlightenment of the Buddha.

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa nye bar bsgrubs nas de'i thugs ka las rdo rje phyung ste nyid kyi phyag tu bzhag par gyur to; ;de nas 'od zer rnam par phyung ste 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar mdzad nas slar log ste bcom ldan
translated: Having accomplished the benefit of all sentient beings, he extracted the vajra from his heart and placed it in his hand. Then, having emitted light rays, he illuminated all world systems, and having returned, the Bhagavān Vairocana

original: 'das kyi thugs kar zhugs nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po'i skur byin gyis brlabs te mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs par rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /

translated: Having entered the heart of the transcendent lords, they transform into the body of the great bodhisattva Samantabhadra, complete with all characteristics and adorned with all ornaments.

analyzed: dar dang phreng bas dbang bskur ba / zla ba'i kha dog lta @45a *//

translated: Then, having emerged from the heart, they stand on moon discs in front of, behind, and to the sides of all transcendent lords, in the form of a garland of great bodhisattvas such as Vajrasattva, Vajradharma, Vajraratna, Vajrakarma, and so on.

translated: Likewise, one should generate the special deities of the goddesses such as Charm, and the deities of Incense, and so on, and the deities of Form, and so on, and the deities of the iron hook, and so on.🔽The maṇḍala of these is taught:

analyzed: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //

analyzed: sangs rgyas dpa' bo thams cad kyis // rdo rje snying po zhes su gsungs //
translated: of all heroes and buddhas.

analyzed: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
translated: It has four corners and four doors,

original: dar dang me tog phreng bas brgyan //
analyzed: dar dang me tog phreng bas brgyan //
translated: adorned with silk and flower garlands.🔽It is surrounded by walls and archways

analyzed: kun nas yongs su gru bzhi pa //
